DataElement.preferredDefinition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits._Span a region or interval of distance, space or time._The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions._human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology._The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary)_To teach theory and hands on experience_To teach theory and hands on experience_An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits. :Span a region or interval of distance, space or time.:The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Concepts.definition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.
Span a region or interval of distance, space or time.
The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

Property.preferredName: Behavior Management Intervention or Procedure Additional Training and Education
Property.preferredDefinition: human or animal activity studied in terms of motivation, direction, result, emotion, perception, or etiology.:The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):To teach theory and hands on experience

Concepts.definition: The actions or reactions of an object or organism, usually in relation to the environment or surrounding world of stimuli.
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
To teach theory and hands on experience

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Which response best represent
ReferenceDocuments.description: Which response best represents the desire you have to receive additional training in providing the following behavioral management procedure:  Hand-over-mouth Technique?
